alert.note: Alert for Wheatland (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 12 at 1:47AM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: .Snow melt from the base of the Little Belt and Crazy Mountains has resulted in minor flooding across portions of western Wheatland County. Minor flooding will linger due to yesterday`s very warm temperatures. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Montana, including the following county, Wheatland. * WHEN...Until 330 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of small creeks and streams, low-lying areas, and culverts. Rural roads and bridges may be washed out or damaged. Livestock may become stranded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 140 AM MDT, flooding persists along Lebo Creek south of Two Dot, and Haymaker Creek north of Two Dot. A few rural roads have been washed out in spots. Culverts are overflowing in some areas. - Reports indicate flooding is mainly in the Two Dot and Martinsdale vicinities, but the Harlowton area could see small creeks flooding as well. Although a cold front ushered in cooler temperatures overnight, lingering snowmelt from yesterday`s very warm temperatures could result in a final, small rise in streams through this morning. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include...Two Dot, Martinsdale, and possibly Harlowton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Remain alert for flooding of creeks, streams, and culverts. Move livestock to higher areas or safe locations so they do not become stranded.
